Deprecated API

Contents

  • Methods
  • Constructors
  • Methods 
    Method Description
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.CountRequest.source​(SearchSourceBuilder)
    The count api only supports a query. Use CountRequest.query(QueryBuilder) instead.
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.CountRequest.types​(String...)
    Types are in the process of being removed. Instead of using a type, prefer to filter on a field on the document.
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.TermVectorsRequest.getType()
    Types are in the process of being removed.
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.TermVectorsResponse.getType()
    Types are in the process of being removed.
    org.elasticsearch.client.graph.GraphExploreRequest.types()
    Types are in the process of being removed. Instead of using a type, prefer to filter on a field on the document.
    org.elasticsearch.client.indices.GetFieldMappingsRequest.local​(boolean)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.clone​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    use IndicesClient.clone(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.cloneAsync​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<ResizeResponse>)
    use IndicesClient.cloneAsync(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.create​(CreateIndexRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.create(CreateIndexRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.createAsync​(CreateIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<CreateIndexResponse>)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.createAsync(CreateIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.exists​(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.exists(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.existsAsync​(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<Boolean>)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.existsAsync(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.flushSynced​(SyncedFlushRequest, RequestOptions)
    synced flush is deprecated and will be removed in 8.0. Use IndicesClient.flush(FlushRequest, RequestOptions) instead.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.flushSyncedAsync​(SyncedFlushRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<SyncedFlushResponse>)
    synced flush is deprecated and will be removed in 8.0. Use IndicesClient.flushAsync(FlushRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.forceMerge​(ForceMergeRequest, RequestOptions)
    use IndicesClient.forcemerge(ForceMergeRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.forceMergeAsync​(ForceMergeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<ForceMergeResponse>)
    use IndicesClient.forcemergeAsync(ForceMergeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.get​(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.get(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getAsync​(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<GetIndexResponse>)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.getAsync(GetIndexRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getFieldMapping​(GetFieldMappingsRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses old request and response objects which still refer to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.getFieldMapping(GetFieldMappingsRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getFieldMappingAsync​(GetFieldMappingsRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<GetFieldMappingsResponse>)
    This method uses old request and response objects which still refer to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.getFieldMappingAsync(GetFieldMappingsRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getMapping​(GetMappingsRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses old request and response objects which still refer to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.getMapping(GetMappingsRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getMappingAsync​(GetMappingsRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<GetMappingsResponse>)
    This method uses old request and response objects which still refer to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.getMapping(GetMappingsRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getTemplate​(GetIndexTemplatesRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses an old response object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. Use IndicesClient.getIndexTemplate(GetIndexTemplatesRequest, RequestOptions) instead which returns a new response object
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.getTemplateAsync​(GetIndexTemplatesRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<GetIndexTemplatesResponse>)
    This method uses an old response object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. Use IndicesClient.getIndexTemplateAsync(GetIndexTemplatesRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead which returns a new response object
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.putMapping​(PutMappingRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.putMapping(PutMappingRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.putMappingAsync​(PutMappingRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<AcknowledgedResponse>)
    This method uses an old request object which still refers to types, a deprecated feature. The method IndicesClient.putMappingAsync(PutMappingRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.putTemplate​(PutIndexTemplateRequest, RequestOptions)
    This old form of request allows types in mappings. Use IndicesClient.putTemplate(PutIndexTemplateRequest, RequestOptions) instead which introduces a new request object without types.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.putTemplateAsync​(PutIndexTemplateRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<AcknowledgedResponse>)
    This old form of request allows types in mappings. Use IndicesClient.putTemplateAsync(PutIndexTemplateRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead which introduces a new request object without types.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.rollover​(RolloverRequest, RequestOptions)
    This method uses deprecated request and response objects. The method IndicesClient.rollover(RolloverRequest, RequestOptions) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.rolloverAsync​(RolloverRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<RolloverResponse>)
    This method uses deprecated request and response objects. The method IndicesClient.rolloverAsync(RolloverRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) should be used instead, which accepts a new request object.
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.shrink​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    use IndicesClient.shrink(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.shrinkAsync​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<ResizeResponse>)
    use IndicesClient.shrinkAsync(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.split​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    use IndicesClient.split(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions)
    org.elasticsearch.client.IndicesClient.splitAsync​(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<ResizeResponse>)
    use IndicesClient.splitAsync(ResizeRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener)
    org.elasticsearch.client.ml.datafeed.DatafeedUpdate.Builder.setJobId​(String)
    org.elasticsearch.client.ml.GetTrainedModelsRequest.setIncludeDefinition​(Boolean)
    Use GetTrainedModelsRequest.includeDefinition()
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.existsSource​(GetRequest, RequestOptions)
    use RestHighLevelClient.existsSource(GetSourceRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.existsSourceAsync​(GetRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<Boolean>)
    use RestHighLevelClient.existsSourceAsync(GetSourceRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.multiGet​(MultiGetRequest, RequestOptions)
    use RestHighLevelClient.mget(MultiGetRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.multiGetAsync​(MultiGetRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<MultiGetResponse>)
    use RestHighLevelClient.mgetAsync(MultiGetRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.multiSearch​(MultiSearchRequest, RequestOptions)
    use RestHighLevelClient.msearch(MultiSearchRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.multiSearchAsync​(MultiSearchRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<MultiSearchResponse>)
    use RestHighLevelClient.msearchAsync(MultiSearchRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequest​(Req, CheckedFunction<Req, Request, IOException>, RequestOptions, CheckedFunction<Response, Resp, IOException>, Set<Integer>)
    If creating a new HLRC ReST API call, consider creating new actions instead of reusing server actions. The Validation layer has been added to the ReST client, and requests should extend Validatable instead of ActionRequest.
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequestAndParseEntity​(Req, CheckedFunction<Req, Request, IOException>, RequestOptions, CheckedFunction<XContentParser, Resp, IOException>, Set<Integer>)
    If creating a new HLRC ReST API call, consider creating new actions instead of reusing server actions. The Validation layer has been added to the ReST client, and requests should extend Validatable instead of ActionRequest.
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequestAsync​(Req, CheckedFunction<Req, Request, IOException>, RequestOptions, CheckedFunction<Response, Resp, IOException>, ActionListener<Resp>, Set<Integer>)
    If creating a new HLRC ReST API call, consider creating new actions instead of reusing server actions. The Validation layer has been added to the ReST client, and requests should extend Validatable instead of ActionRequest.
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.performRequestAsyncAndParseEntity​(Req, CheckedFunction<Req, Request, IOException>, RequestOptions, CheckedFunction<XContentParser, Resp, IOException>, ActionListener<Resp>, Set<Integer>)
    If creating a new HLRC ReST API call, consider creating new actions instead of reusing server actions. The Validation layer has been added to the ReST client, and requests should extend Validatable instead of ActionRequest.
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.searchScroll​(SearchScrollRequest, RequestOptions)
    use RestHighLevelClient.scroll(SearchScrollRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.RestHighLevelClient.searchScrollAsync​(SearchScrollRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener<SearchResponse>)
    use RestHighLevelClient.scrollAsync(SearchScrollRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.changePassword​(RequestOptions, ChangePasswordRequest)
    use SecurityClient.changePassword(ChangePasswordRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.changePasswordAsync​(RequestOptions, ChangePasswordRequest, ActionListener<Boolean>)
    use SecurityClient.changePasswordAsync(ChangePasswordRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.disableUser​(RequestOptions, DisableUserRequest)
    use SecurityClient.disableUser(DisableUserRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.disableUserAsync​(RequestOptions, DisableUserRequest, ActionListener<Boolean>)
    use SecurityClient.disableUserAsync(DisableUserRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.enableUser​(RequestOptions, EnableUserRequest)
    use SecurityClient.enableUser(EnableUserRequest, RequestOptions) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.SecurityClient.enableUserAsync​(RequestOptions, EnableUserRequest, ActionListener<Boolean>)
    use SecurityClient.enableUserAsync(EnableUserRequest, RequestOptions, ActionListener) instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.pivot.PivotConfig.Builder.setMaxPageSearchSize​(Integer)
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.pivot.PivotConfig.getMaxPageSearchSize()
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.TransformIndexerStats.getNumDocuments()
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.TransformIndexerStats.getNumInvocations()
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.TransformIndexerStats.getNumPages()
    org.elasticsearch.client.transform.transforms.TransformIndexerStats.getOutputDocuments()
    org.elasticsearch.client.xpack.XPackInfoResponse.FeatureSetsInfo.FeatureSet.nativeCodeInfo()
    Use ML info api to find native code info
  • Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.CountRequest​(String[], SearchSourceBuilder)
    The count api only supports a query. Use CountRequest(String[], QueryBuilder) instead.
    org.elasticsearch.client.core.TermVectorsRequest​(String, String, String)
    Types are in the process of being removed, use TermVectorsRequest(String, String) instead.
    org.elasticsearch.client.rollup.job.config.DateHistogramGroupConfig​(String, DateHistogramInterval)
    Build a DateHistoConfig using DateHistogramGroupConfig.CalendarInterval or DateHistogramGroupConfig.FixedInterval instead
    org.elasticsearch.client.security.PutRoleMappingRequest​(String, boolean, List<String>, RoleMapperExpression, Map<String, Object>, RefreshPolicy)
    org.elasticsearch.client.security.PutUserRequest​(User, char[], boolean, RefreshPolicy)
    Use PutUserRequest.withPassword(User, char[], boolean, RefreshPolicy) or PutUserRequest.updateUser(User, boolean, RefreshPolicy) instead.
